system.description:
Your mix of bottled fury and ingenuity sometimes lets you fix things with a good thump—whether that’s malfunctioning gear or enemies causing problems. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Strength, Constitution, or Intelligence increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • While you are raging, if you use Tactical Chemistry to create acid, alchemist’s fire, a black powder charge, a flash bomb, a flask of oil, a paint pot, a smoke bomb, or a tanglefoot bag, you can throw it as part of the same bonus action.
  • You gain proficiency with the Grinding Cog combat tradition and a maneuver of a level you could learn from it. It does not count against your maneuvers known.
  • You learn the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.pblaa5w3f6tuqxuj]{Mending} cantrip if you do not already know it or a cantrip from the Weaponry school if you do.
  • You can spend an action and roll a [[/r d4]] to attempt to repair an item, structure, or creature of the Construct type with a heavy thump. On a roll of 1-3, it regains hit points equal to [[/r 2d8]] + your Intelligence modifier. On a roll of 4, it takes [[/r 1d8]] points of bludgeoning damage instead. Once you have used this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
system.prerequisite: 3 levels in artificer, 3 levels in berserker
